action.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3605 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Makes in order as an original bill the Committee on resources amendment in the nature of a substitute now printed in the bill as an original bill for the purpsoe of amendment. Measure will be considered read. Bill is open to amendments. The amendment printed in H. Rept. 106-654 shall be considered as read. The bill shall be considered for amendment under the five-minute rule.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Bill Barrett to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 516 and Rule XXIII.

GENERAL DEBATE - The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 3605. The rule made in order the Committee on Resources amendment in the nature of a substitute, now printed in the bill, as an original bill for the purpose of amendment, which shall be open for amendment at any point.
The Committee is debating the amendment offered by Mr. Udall of Colorado.
The Committee is debating the substitute amendment offered by Mr. Boehlert.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on agreeing to the substitute amendment offered by Mr. Boehlert by voice vote and announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Udall of Colroado objected to the voice vote. Pursuant to H. Res. 516, the Chair postponed further proceedings on the Boehlert substitute and the underlying Udall of Colorado amendments.
The Committee is debating the amendment offered by Mr. Inslee.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on agreeing to the Inslee amendment by voice vote and announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Inslee objected to the voice vote. Pursuant to H. Res. 516, the Chair postponed further proceedings on the amendment.
The Committee is debating the amendment offered by Mr. Holt.
The Committee is debating the substitute amendment offered by Mr. Boehlert.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - The Chair put the question on agreeing to the substitute amendment offered by Mr. Boehlert by voice vote and announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Holt objected to the voice vote. Pursuant to H. Res. 516, the Chair postponed further proceedings on the Boehlert substitute and the underlying Holt amendments.
The Committee is debating the amendment offered by Mr. Cook.

ORDER OF PROCEEDINGS - Proceedings will resume on amendments postponed earlier in the following order: (1) Boehlert substitute amendment to the amendment offered by Mr. Udall of Colorado, (2) Udall underlying amendment; (3) amendment offered by Mr. Inslee; (4) Boehlert substitute amendment to the amendment offered by Mr. Holt; and (5) Holt underlying amendment.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 3605 as unfinished business.

bill.summary: 6/6/2000--Reported to House amended. TABLE OF CONTENTS: Title I: San Rafael Western Legacy District Title II: San Rafael National Conservation Area San Rafael Western Legacy District and National Conservation Act - Title I: San Rafael Western Legacy District - Establishes the San Rafael Western Legacy District (SRWLD) in Utah. Requires the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Director of the National Park Service, to establish a Legacy Council to furnish advice regarding management, grants, projects, and technical assistance.Authorizes the Secretary to make grants (of up to 50 percent of the total cost of an SRWLD activity) and provide technical assistance to any nonprofit organization or government unit with authority in the SRWLD's boundaries. Authorizes appropriations.Title II: San Rafael National Conservation Area - Establishes the San Rafael National Conservation Area in Utah. Requires the Secretary to develop a comprehensive management plan.Prohibits the use of motorized vehicles in the Conservation Area (except for reasonable access to private or State lands) at all times in areas where roads and trails did not exist as of February 2, 2000. Limits the use of such vehicles to designated roads and trails existing before such date.Requires the United States to acquire any additional water resources needed for purposes of this Act only in accordance with Utah State water law.Authorizes appropriations.
